column4: Inar: all right, I installed the correct backports module, but still no go
Inar: yes
is ubuntu already installed, or are you using a live cd?
type uname -a in terminal does it mention SMP anywhere?
yes, it does
then dual core should work
well, tell that to my box
lol
how do you know only 1 is working? checked in system monitor?
that, and cat /proc/cpuinfo lists only one core
oh ok
is there a setting in the BIOS to enable dual core?
Still having problems with Ubuntu only using one core of my AMDX2 system. Can anybody help?
is there a setting in the BIOS to enable dual core?
I'm not sure, I haven't check. It worked OOB with the amd64 version of Hardy, though, so I don't think it's a BIOS issue
are you using the generic kernel?    2.6.24-16-generic #1 SMP
well, it's 2.6.24-17-generic
have you tried different kernels by selecting them in startup manager and rebooting?
yes,
the only thing that's worked is an amd64 installation, but I don't want to use that for compatibility reasons
well its a bug and been reportrd but i dont see a fix listed yet   https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/213011
ok, thanks
